thread.title: Harvey Norman outlays $34m for dairy farm stake
thread.title_full: Harvey Norman outlays $34m for dairy farm stake | afr.com

author: Sue Mitchell
title: Harvey Norman outlays $34m for dairy farm stake
text:
Retailer and racehorse owner Gerry Harvey is diversifying into dairy farming. Glenn Hunt Share on twitter by Sue Mitchell Furniture and appliances retailer Harvey Norman is diversifying into dairy farming and cattle breeding, paying $34 million for a stake in Coomboona Holdings, one of Australia's largest dairy farms.
Harvey Norman told the stock exchange on Wednesday it had acquired a 49.9 per cent stake in Coomboona Holdings for about $25 million and had agreed to make an advance of about $9 million to the company.
Coomboona owns land and farm assets including dairy farms in the Coomboona district of the Goulburn Valley region in northern Victoria. It also operates a pedigree breeding and genetics business.
Harvey Norman's co-founder and largest shareholder, Gerry Harvey, owns Australia's largest thoroughbred sales company, Magic Millions, and has interests in beef cattle.
However, it is believed to be the first time that his publicly listed company has invested in the agriculture sector.
The Australian Financial Review reported in June that Mr Harvey was eyeing an investment in the Coomboona Holsteins operation.
More to come.
